    About Jason Wu:
    After interning for Narciso Rodriguez, designer Jason Wu launched his own collection in 2006. He immediately landed on the radar of fashion's elite, who lauded his clean and sophisticated aesthetic. New York-based Jason Wu, a native of Taipei who has also lived in Vancouver and Paris, creates refined American sportswear while playfully mixing Old World and modern elements with dashes of color and feminine combinations. He won the 2010 Swarovski Award for Women's Wear at the CFDA Fashion Awards.

    About Jean Paul Gaultier:
    French designer Jean Paul Gaultier started his career in 1970 as an assistant at Pierre Cardin. In 1976, he launched his label with a style that drew more from the London street scene than Parisian couture. In addition to his men's and women's ready-to-wear lines, and the haute couture line he launched in 1997, Jean Paul Gaultier offers a collection of provocative fragrances in distinctive bottles that are every bit as avant garde as the designer's clothes.

    About J Brand Ready To Wear:
    Under the creative direction of Donald Oliver and his design team, the J Brand Ready To Wear expands the J Brand collection, taking you through a sartorial spiritual journey. Darkness and leather are met with soft-to-the-touch fabrics and chiffon. Pure nirvana is later attained with a palette of white and ivory and soft silhouettes. The collection then returns to mother earth with military influences and airy earth tones. With unexpected pops of color throughout, an easy sensibility is achieved with subtle execution and detail.

    About Oscar de la Renta:
    After apprenticing at Balenciaga in Spain and at Lanvin in Paris, Dominican designer Oscar de la Renta launched his own eponymous line in 1965. His refined, ladylike looks have garnered many awards, including one in 1990 for Lifetime Achievement. In 1998, he launched a successful line of lingerie and his momentum shows no signs of waning with the collections of eyewear, fragrance, home decor, handbags, and shoes.

About Amanda Uprichard

American Designer Amanda Uprichard launched her eponymous clothing line in 2003. Like the designer herself, the Amanda Uprichard woman runs her own company during the day, meets up with her girls for happy hour after that. At home she's a power mother juggling family, work, and life in general. She's well read, travels a lot, or is constantly expanding her horizon. She's attracted to the collection for their sophistication and comfort, and because they transition nicely from work to evening events. She wants dresses she can wear to weddings, to gallery openings, to see the in-laws, to sweat in on the dance floor.

Details
Kelsie

Robert Rodriguez:
After attending the Fashion Institute of Technology in New York and working at Christian Dior, Robert Rodriguez launched his eponymous line in 2003. The collection quickly became known for its sexy, sophisticated styles, and the designer was inducted into the Council of Fashion Designers of America in 2010.

About For Love & Lemons:

Designers, owners, and BFFs Gillian Mahin and Laura Hall are the masterminds behind For Love & Lemons. Born in Wyoming, and now based in Los Angeles, the collection is anything but conventional - rebelling against the standards of modern society. The line taunts intrigue, as a clash of colors and patterns are balanced by chic separates and devious dresses. Where the modern gypsy is punk, For Love & Lemons is a brand for the girl who doesn't follow trends, she makes them.

About JOIE:
Since its inception in 2001, JOIE has successfully filled a void in the contemporary market. Unlike other brands, which are classification driven and offer single items such as denim or graphic tees, JOIE provides the modern, fashion savvy customer with a global wardrobe. Though the company got its start with its signature cargos, today it's best known for offering feminine tops, dresses, and cashmere sweaters. JOIE recently introduced its footwear collection, and the line is the perfect reflection of the lifestyle brand, offering everything from boots to sandals. The JOIE concept has always been: "Casual, Comfortable, and Luxurious." Therefore, each piece that is designed encompasses a balance of these three key elements... one cannot exist without the other.

Designer
About JOIE:
Since its inception in 2001, JOIE has successfully filled a void in the contemporary market. Unlike other brands, which are classification driven and offer single items such as denim or graphic tees, JOIE provides the modern, fashion savvy customer with a global wardrobe. Though the company got its start with its signature cargos, today it's best known for offering feminine tops, dresses, and cashmere sweaters. JOIE recently introduced its footwear collection, and the line is the perfect reflection of the lifestyle brand, offering everything from boots to sandals. The JOIE concept has always been: "Casual, Comfortable, and Luxurious." Therefore, each piece that is designed encompasses a balance of these three key elements... one cannot exist without the other.
Modern Size Guide

    About Jean Paul Gaultier:
    French designer Jean Paul Gaultier started his career in 1970 as an assistant at Pierre Cardin. In 1976, he launched his label with a style that drew more from the London street scene than Parisian couture. In addition to his men's and women's ready-to-wear lines, and the haute couture line he launched in 1997, Jean Paul Gaultier offers a collection of provocative fragrances in distinctive bottles that are every bit as avant garde as the designer's clothes.
    Details

productName: Tambrel Sweater with Asymmetric Hem, Heather Midnight
extraInformation:
Details
  • Tambrel Sweater with Asymmetric Hem, Heather Midnight
    • Designer
    About JOIE:
    Since its inception in 2001, JOIE has successfully filled a void in the contemporary market. Unlike other brands, which are classification driven and offer single items such as denim or graphic tees, JOIE provides the modern, fashion savvy customer with a global wardrobe. Though the company got its start with its signature cargos, today it's best known for offering feminine tops, dresses, and cashmere sweaters. JOIE recently introduced its footwear collection, and the line is the perfect reflection of the lifestyle brand, offering everything from boots to sandals. The JOIE concept has always been: "Casual, Comfortable, and Luxurious." Therefore, each piece that is designed encompasses a balance of these three key elements... one cannot exist without the other.
    Details
  • Alvarine Stretch Leather Leggings:
    The Joie Alvarine leather leggings present a sleek alternative to predictable skinny jeans.
    • Lambskin.
    • Regular 9" rise.
    • Fitted through skinny legs; 9 1/2" leg openings.
    • 27 1/2" inseam; cropped at ankle.
    • Imported.
    • Designer

The Factory

We make our Seed Stitch sweaters in Dongguan, China in a small, three-story sweater manufacturing facility that employs just 120 people. The small scale of the operation allows the factory to consistently deliver top-notch knits. Quality is important for the owner and his partner – a native of Los Angeles, where they run their other factory not too far from our own LA office.

The Factory

This factory is located 10 minutes from our LA office, so we get a chance to visit often. Mr. Kim, the owner, has been in the LA garment business for over 30 years and opened this factory in 2004. It’s not unusual to see our production team on-site checking in on the quality of our product before it’s shipped to our warehouse.

Quick Description

Inspired by him but designed for her, the Raglan Boyfriend has a crew neck and a longer fit. It’s made of a neoprene-inspired French Terry fabric—structured but still soft with a little bit of stretch. An understated statement piece you can juxtapose with a skirt or play up the androgyny with a men’s slack.

productName: The Box Cut Tee Muted Black
extraInformation:
More Details
  • 100% Combed Cotton

  • Made in Los Angeles
  • Because this tee is shorter in the body, taller women may want to size up.
  • Model Ana is 5'9" and typically wears an extra small, but is seen here wearing a small and also a medium in many of the lookbook shots.
The Factory

This factory is located 10 minutes from our LA office and we visit it several times a week. Mr. Kim, the owner, has been in the LA garment business for over 30 years and opened this factory in 2004. Impressed with the operation we decided to consolidate almost all of our knit production here and recently documented the making of our tees.

Quick Description

With a more relaxed silhouette, the Box Cut Tee is roomy throughout the body with a slightly cropped hem that sits right at the hip. Features a boyish crew neckline, stitched rolled cuffs, and a front pocket detail.

The Factory

We spent nine months reinventing the Ryan, starting by finding the perfect fabric—a search that sent us to China, Turkey, and all over Europe. We finally decided to develop our own fabric with a factory in Long Beach, California. It's family-owned, all-green and vertically integrated, which means they knit their own fabric and cut, sew and finish everything in-house.

Quick Description

Now in an updated fabric, the Ryan Tank is a versatile closet essential that's able to effortlessly transition between a night out and a day at home. Features stitch details on the neckline and asymmetrical trim. Made in Long Beach alongside some of your designer favorites.
